chav1961.purelib.basic

Class ReusableInstances<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • chav1961.purelib.basic.ReusableInstances<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - instance class to keep in the cache repository
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class ReusableInstances<T>
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable

    This utility class can be used to reduce memory garbage. It contains a cache repository with the reused instances of any referenced class. It also supports two operations on it:

    • allocate new instance of the given class (see allocate() method)
    • free instance of the given class was allocated earlier (see free(Object) method)

    When cache repository is empty on allocation request, it creates a new instance of the given class by calling ReusableInstances.TrueConstructor functional interface to produce it. When cache repository is not empty on allocation request, it prepares any 'old' instance form the cache repository by calling ReusableInstances.PseudoConstructor functional interface and returns it as a 'newly created' instance. Pseudoconstructor must restore all the instance fields into it's initial state. To avoid problems with the restoring, use the final fields in the instance class accurately.

    All the functionality of the class is similar to the malloc()/free() functions in the standard C language library. The class implements AutoCloseable interface and we strongly recommend to use it in the try-with-resource statements. If you doen't need to prepare 'old' instance, don't pass ReusableInstances.PseudoConstructor instance in this class - this strongly increases allocation performance.

    This class can be used in the multi-thread environment

    Since:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    JUnit tests

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ReusableInstances.PseudoConstructor<T>
      This iterface resets existent instance if the class to the initial state
      static interface  ReusableInstances.TrueConstructor<T>
      This interface returns newly created instance to use in the cache
